result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lloyd E. Westphal Jr.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:51 PM Defendant Lloyd E. Westphal in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advised DE of charges and penalties; advised of right to attorney.   Defendant waives time limits for a preliminary hearing. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 11:00 am. - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:35 PM Defendant Lloyd E. Westphal in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advised DE of charges and penalties; advised of right to attorney.  Defendant indicated that he called the public defender's office, but they did not call him back.   Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm. - rt

and endorsement of law enforcement officer
(copy provided to MPD per approval of the Judge)
and Order to Seal Affidavit, Search Warrant, and Accompanying Pleadings (until 7-13-22)

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court.  Must report to Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lloyd E. Westphal appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $2,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of a controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Defendant makes statement on bond.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney and notice was given to defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
Initial Appearance det May 17, 2022 at 1:00 p.m.
